intro: Lysinema brevilimbatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its small, pink to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant's leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive, wavy margin.
